scantool.ptxt: As the data values are standard values estimated on the basis of values obtained from the normally operating vehicles by using a scan tool, use them as reference values. Even when the vehicle is in good condition, there may be cases where the checked value does not fall within each specified data range. Therefore, judgment as abnormal should not be made by checking with these data alone.

Also, conditions that can be checked by the scan tool are those detected by ECM and output from ECM as commands and there may be cases where the engine or actuator is not operating (in the condition) as indicated by the scan tool. Be sure to use the timing light to check the ignition timing.

item.ptxt: With the generic scan tool, only star (*) marked data in the following table can be read.

When checking the data with the engine running at idle or racing, be sure to place gear shift lever in “Neutral” (M/T model) or select lever in “P” range (A/T model) and pull the parking brake fully. Also, if nothing or “no load” is indicated, turn OFF A/C, all electric loads, P/S and all the other switches.

Specified idle speed for 2 min. after warm-up

Specified idle speed with no load after warm-up

Specified idle speed with no load after warm-up

entry.ptxt: O2S B1 S2 Act (O2S B1 S2 ACT

topic.title: Fuel System (Fuel System Status)
topic.ptxt: A/F ratio feedback loop status displayed as one of the followings.
OL: Open-loop has not yet satisfied engine conditions (ECT > 10 °C, IAT, TP, A/F sensor/system = OK) to go closed loop.
CL: Closed-loop using oxygen sensor(s) as feedback for fuel control.
OL-DRIVE: Open-loop due to driving conditions (Power enrichment, etc.).
OL-FAULT: Open-loop due to detected system fault.

topic.title: Short Term Fuel Trim (%)
topic.ptxt: Short term fuel trim value represents short term corrections to the air/fuel mixture computation. A value of 0 indicates no correction, a value greater than 0 means an enrichment correction, and a value less than 0 implies an enleanment correction.

topic.title: Long Term Fuel Trim (%)
topic.ptxt: Long term fuel trim value represents long term corrections to the air/fuel mixture computation. A value of 0 indicates no correction, a value greater than 0 means an enrichment correction, and a value less than 0 implies an enleanment correction.

topic.title: Total Fuel Trim (%)
topic.ptxt: The value of Total Fuel Trim is obtained by calculating based on values of Short Term Fuel Trim and Long Term Fuel Trim. This value indicates how much correction is necessary to keep the air/fuel mixture stoichiometrical.

topic.title: Inj Pulse Width (Fuel Injection Pulse Width, msec.)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates time of the injector drive (valve opening) pulse which is output from ECM (but injector drive time of NO.1 cylinder for multiport fuel injection).

topic.title: Ignition Advance (Ignition Timing Advance for NO.1 Cylinder, ° BTDC)
topic.ptxt: Ignition timing of No.1 cylinder commanded by ECM. The actual ignition timing should be checked using the timing light.

topic.title: Calculated Load (Calculated Load Value, %)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates calculated engine load in percent based on input signal to ECM from various engine sensors.

topic.title: Engine Speed (rpm)
topic.ptxt: It is computed from reference pulses from the camshaft position sensor.

topic.title: Desired Idle (Desired Idle Speed, rpm)
topic.ptxt: The Desired Idle Speed is an ECM internal parameter which indicates the ECM requested idle. If the engine is not running, this number is not valid.

topic.title: MAF (Mass Air Flow rate, g/sec, lb/min.)
topic.ptxt: It represents total mass of air entering intake manifold which is measured by MAF sensor.

topic.title: Vehicle Speed (km/h, mph)
topic.ptxt: It is computed based on pulse signals from front wheel speed sensors.

topic.title: ECT (Engine Coolant Temperature, °C, °F)
topic.ptxt: It is detected by engine coolant temperature sensor.

topic.title: Intake Air Temperature. (°C, °F)
topic.ptxt: It is detected by intake air temperature sensor.

topic.title: Barometric Pres (kPa, mmHg, inHg, bar)
topic.ptxt: This parameter represents a measurement of barometric air pressure and is used for altitude correction of the fuel injection quantity.

topic.title: Evap Canist Prg Duty (Evap Canister Purge Flow Duty, %)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates valve ON (valve open) time rate within a certain set cycle of EVAP canister purge valve which controls the amount of EVAP purge.

topic.title: VVT Gap (Target Actual Position, °)
topic.ptxt: It is calculated using the formula: target valve timing advance-actual valve timing advance.

topic.title: IMRC Valve (Intake Manifold Runner Control Valve, V)
topic.ptxt: IMRC valve position sensor reading provides IMRC valve opening information in the form of voltage.

topic.title: IMRC Valve (Com) (Intake Manifold Runner Control Command, Open/Close)
topic.ptxt: Open: Open command being output to IMRC valve actuator.
Close: Close command being output to IMRC valve actuator.

topic.title: IMRC Valve (Mon) (Intake Manifold Runner Control Valve Monitor, Open/Closed)
topic.ptxt: Open: IMRC valve is fully opened.
Close: IMRC valve is fully closed.

topic.title: IAC Throttle Opening (Idle Air Throttle Valve Opening, %)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates throttle valve opening of idle air control in %.
(100% indicates the maximum idle air flow.)

topic.title: TP Sensor 1 Volt (TP Sensor (Main) Output Voltage, V)
topic.ptxt: TP Sensor (Main) reading provides throttle valve opening information in the form of voltage.

topic.title: TP Sensor 2 Volt (TP Sensor (SUB) Output Voltage, V)
topic.ptxt: TP Sensor (Sub) reading provides throttle valve opening information in the form of voltage.

topic.title: APP Sensor 1 Volt (APP Sensor (Main) Output voltage, V)
topic.ptxt: APP Sensor (Main) reading provides accelerator pedal opening information in the form of voltage.

topic.title: APP Sensor 2 Volt (APP Sensor (sub) Output Voltage, V)
topic.ptxt: APP Sensor (Sub) reading provides accelerator pedal opening information in the form of voltage.

topic.title: Accel Position (Absolute Accelerator Pedal Position, %)
topic.ptxt: When accelerator pedal is fully released position, accelerator pedal position is indicated as 0 – 5% and 90 – 100% when it is in fully depressed position.

topic.title: Throttle Position (Absolute Throttle Position, %)
topic.ptxt: When TP sensor is at fully closed position, throttle opening is indicated as 0 – 5% and 90 – 100% full open position.

topic.title: Target throttle Posi (Target throttle Valve Position, %)
topic.ptxt: Target Throttle Valve Position is ECM internal parameter which indicates the ECM requested throttle valve position.

topic.title: Throttle Motor Volt (Throttle Motor Supply Voltage) (V)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates power supply voltage of throttle motor (motor) control circuit (input voltage from throttle motor control relay).

topic.title: O2S B1 S2 (HO2S, V)
topic.ptxt: It indicates output voltage of HO2S installed on exhaust manifold (post-TWC). It is used to detect catalyst deterioration.

topic.title: A/F B1 S1 Current (A/F Sensor Output Current, mA)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates output current of A/F sensor installed on exhaust No.1 pipe (pre-TWC).

topic.title: Battery Voltage (V)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates battery positive voltage inputted from main relay to ECM.

topic.title: A/C Pressure (A/C Refrigerant Absolute Pressure, kPa)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates A/C refrigerant absolute pressure calculated by ECM.

topic.title: Generator Cont Duty (Generator Control Duty, %)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates generator control duty ratio that controls production electricity of generator by ECM.
100%: No limitation for the generating
0%: Maximum limitation for the generating

topic.title: Generator Field Duty (Generator Field Coil Duty, %)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates operating rate (status of production electricity) for generator by field coil duty ratio.
100%: maximum operation.
0%: minimum operation.

topic.title: Radiator Fan (Radiator Cooling Fan Control Relay, Low/Mid/Hi)
topic.ptxt: Low: ON command being output to radiator cooling fan relay No.1.
Mid: ON command being output to radiator fan relay No.1 and No.3
Hi: ON command being output to radiator cooling fan relay No.1, No.2 and No.3.
OFF: No command being output.

topic.title: A/C Comp Relay (A/C Compressor Relay, On/Off)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates the state of the A/C compressor relay.

topic.title: Fuel Pump (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: ON is displayed when ECM activates the fuel pump via the fuel pump relay switch.

topic.title: IMT Valve Actuator (Intake Manifold Tuning Valve, Open/Close)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates the state of IMT valve actuator.

topic.title: Throttle Motor Relay (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: ON: Throttle motor relay control is activated by ECM.
OFF: Throttle motor relay control is stopped by ECM.

topic.title: Starter SW (Starter Switch, ON / OFF)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates condition of starting motor relay output.
ON: Starting motor relay is ON
OFF: Starting motor relay is OFF

topic.title: PSP Switch (P/S signal) (Power Steering Pump Pressure Switch, On / Off)
topic.ptxt: ON: PSP SW is ON (P/S high pressure switch is ON)
OFF: PSP SW is OFF (P/S high pressure switch is OFF)

topic.title: A/C Switch (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: ON: Command for A/C operation being output from ECM to HVAC.
OFF: Command for A/C operation not being output.

topic.title: Blower Fan (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates the state of the blower fan motor switch.

topic.title: Brake Switch (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates the state of the brake switch.

topic.title: Electric Load (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: ON: Headlight, small light or rear defogger ON signal inputted.
OFF: Above electric loads all turned OFF.

topic.title: PNP Signal (P/N or D range) (A/T model)
topic.ptxt: Whether the transmission range switch is in P or N range or other ranges is displayed. If it is in P or N range, “P/N” is displayed and if it is in other than “P” and “N”, “D” is displayed.

topic.title: Fuel Cut (On/Off)
topic.ptxt: ON: Fuel being cut (output signal to injector is stopped)
OFF: Fuel not being cut

topic.title: Closed Throttle Pos (Closed Throttle Position, On/Off)
topic.ptxt: This parameter reads ON when throttle valve is fully closed, or OFF when it is not fully closed.

topic.title: O2S B1 S2 ACT (HO2S, Active / Inactive)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates activation condition of HO2S
ACTIVE: Activating
INACTIVE: Warming up or at stop.

topic.title: A/F B1 S1 ACT (A/F Sensor, Active / Inactive)
topic.ptxt: This parameter indicates activation condition of A/F sensor
ACTIVE: Activating
INACTIVE: Warming up or at stop
